data.title: Is Edward Scissorhands a Christmas movie?
data.meta_description: FANS of Edward Scissorhands love putting the movie on over the festive season.But the question has often arisen, is the 1990 Tim Burton classic really
data.text:
FANS of Edward Scissorhands love putting the movie on over the festive season.

But the question has often arisen, is the 1990 Tim Burton classic really a Christmas film?

Is Edward Scissorhands a Christmas movie?

Despite the fact that the movie starts off in the summer, it certainly has wintery undertones midway through, and does include Christmas later on.

Who can forget the moment where Edward Scissorhands cuts an angel out of ice?

The fairy tale aspect of the movie also lends itself to being a festive flick.

In fact, after much research, all the big movie reviewers believe that Edward Scissorhands should be considered a Christmas film

One reviewer for Distractify said: "If 1984's Gremlins and 1988's Die Hard are considered Christmas films, then so is Edward Scissorhands.

"They're all filed under the 'unconventional' Christmas movie category.

"Edward Scissorhands' third act sees Peg and Kim prepare for their annual Christmas party.

"While decorating a glowing white Christmas tree with her mother, Kim peers out the window to see fluffy snow falling from the sky.

"When the wide-eyed teen scurries outside to get a better look, she realises that the "snow" is actually the work of Edward."

They go on: "As he carves a magnificent angel ice sculpture with his razor-sharp appendages, tiny shards of ice fly through the air, creating a picturesque wintery scene on Kim's front lawn.

"Mesmerised by its beauty, Kim twirls under the faux snow â€” in slow motion, of course."

Meanwhile, regmovies.com says: "The biggest piece of evidence in support rests with the fact that the last half of the movie is centered around the Christmas season, not to mention that the entire narrative is framed around a grandmother telling her grandchild why it always snows on Christmas.

"After an annual Christmas party goes awry, we are surrounded by a festive neighborhood with plenty of Christmas lights and decorated trees - even the most melancholy flashback to the saddening death of the Inventor takes place around this same time of year. "

So yes, Edward Scissorhands IS a Christmas movie.

Who stars in Edward Scissorhands and what is it about?

A scientist builds an animated human being - the gentle Edward.

The scientist dies before he can finish assembling Edward, though, leaving the young man with a freakish appearance accentuated by the scissor blades he has instead of hands.

Loving suburban saleswoman Peg discovers Edward and takes him home, where he falls for her daughter, Kim

However, despite his kindness and artistic talent, he soon becomes an outcast once more.

The all-star cast includes:

Johnny Depp as Edward Scissorhands

Winona Ryder as Kim Boggs

Anthony Michael Hall as Jim

Dianne Wiest as Peg Boggs

Kathy Baker as Joyce Monroe

Alan Arkin as Bill Boggs

Vincent Price as The Inventor

How old was Winona Ryder in Edward Scissorhands?

Winona Ryder was just 18 in Edward Scissorhands when she played the character Kim.

The young actress must have made an impression on director Tim Burton, as she has since starred in four of his films.
